metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11784 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When the default servlet in Apache Tomcat versions 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.11,8.5.0 to 8.5.33 and 7.0.23 to 7.0.90 returned a redirect to a directory(e.g. redirecting to '/foo/' when the user requested '/foo') a speciallycrafted URL could be used to cause the redirect to be generated to any URIof the attackers choice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8 - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-common - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
tomcat8-user - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
tomcat8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.1').
